shapes.name: Content Placeholder 2
shapes.text_content:
T-TABLE. Write down a t-table with 5 points for the parent graph.
ANALYZE. Determine the transformations of the function.

paragraphs.text: T-TABLE. Write down a t-table with 5 points for the parent graph.

runs.text: T-TABLE. Write down a t-table with 5 points for the parent graph.

paragraphs.text: ANALYZE. Determine the transformations of the function.

runs.text: ANALYZE. Determine the transformations of the function.

paragraphs.text: vertical stretch
vertical translation
period
phase shift

shapes.name: TextBox 9
shapes.text_content:
NEW X-COORDINATES. Use the period, then phase shift to adjust the x-coordinates from the parent graphs t-table.
NEW Y-COORDINATES. Use the vertical stretch, then vertical translation to adjust the y-coordinates from the parent graphs t-table.
Set up axes, scale, plot points, and draw the graph!

paragraphs.text: NEW X-COORDINATES. Use the period, then phase shift to adjust the x-coordinates from the parent graphs t-table.

runs.text: phase shift to adjust the x-coordinates from the parent graphs t-table.

paragraphs.text: NEW Y-COORDINATES. Use the vertical stretch, then vertical translation to adjust the y-coordinates from the parent graphs t-table.

runs.text: NEW Y-COORDINATES. Use the vertical stretch,
vertical translation to adjust the y-coordinates from the parent graphs t-table.

paragraphs.text: Set up axes, scale, plot points, and draw the graph!

runs.text: Set up axes, scale, plot points, and draw the graph!

shapes.name: TextBox 10
shapes.text_content:
The order matters:

multiply before add/subtract!

paragraphs.text: The order matters:
multiply before add/subtract!

all_text: Steps for graphing a tangent or cotangent function

T-TABLE. Write down a t-table with 5 points for the parent graph.
ANALYZE. Determine the transformations of the function.

NEW X-COORDINATES. Use the period, then phase shift to adjust the x-coordinates from the parent graphs t-table.
NEW Y-COORDINATES. Use the vertical stretch, then vertical translation to adjust the y-coordinates from the parent graphs t-table.
Set up axes, scale, plot points, and draw the graph!

The order matters:

multiply before add/subtract!
slides.notes: Teacher, if these steps are confusing, please watch my video where I show the process: https://www.hoffmath.com/2024/09/tangent.html

paragraphs.text: multiply ys by 2
subtract 1 from ys

shapes.name: TextBox 11
shapes.text_content: multiply ys by 2, then subtract 1 from ys

paragraphs.text: multiply ys by 2, then subtract 1 from ys
multiply xs by 3

all_text: multiply ys by 2, then subtract 1 from ys
